contentrichtext.text: '''Korea Standard Time''' ('''KST'''; {{lang-ko|한국 표준시}} or 조선 표준시; [[Hanja]]: {{lang|ko|韓國標準時}} or 朝鮮標準時; ''Han-guk pyojunsi'' or ''Joseon pyojunsi'') is the standard time zone in [[North Korea|North]] and [[South Korea]] and is 9 hours ahead of [[UTC]] ([[UTC+09:00]]): i.e., when it is midnight (00:00) [[UTC]], it is 9 am (09:00) Korea Standard Time. Korea does not currently observe [[daylight saving time]] but has experimented with it in the past.<ref>[http://webexhibits.org/daylightsaving/g.html When is daylight saving time worldwide?<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/timezone.html?n=235&syear=1980 South Korea time changes]</ref>{{clarify|reason=North or South experimented it? |date=July 2013 }} Korea Standard Time is the same as [[Japan Standard Time]], [[Time in Indonesia|Indonesian Eastern Standard Time]] and [[Irkutsk Time]]. ==History== The [[Korean Empire]] adopted a standard time of 8.5 hours ahead of UTC. In 1912, following the [[Korea under Japanese rule|introduction of Imperial Japanese rule]], the colonial government changed this to [[Japan Standard Time]]. ==See also== * [[List of Korea-related topics]] * [[Timezone]] * [[UTC+09]] * [[Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://english.kriss.re.kr Official Homepage of the Korea Research Institute of Standard and Science]{{en icon}} [[Category:Time zones]] [[Category:Time in South Korea]] [[de:UTC+9#Korea-Standardzeit]] {{split|Korea Standard Time (South Korea)|Korea Standard Time (North Korea)|date=July 2013}}
